notes:
Issue #32 Volkswagen Tarek 2003 J. Kleinschmidt/F. Pons

The 2003 Dakar departed from the coastal city of Marseille, France on January 1 and took competitors through France, Spain, Tunisia, Libya and finishing in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt on January 19 for a total of 3,241 miles. This was only the 2nd time the rally finished in Egypt instead of Dakar, Senegal.

2003 marked the return of Volkwagen to the Dakar after their victory 13 years earlier. They returned with 5 vehicles and the goal of beating their Japanese rivals at Mitsubishi. Volkswagen even had former Mitsubishi driver and 2001 Dakar winner Jutta Kleinschmidt on the team.

Launched at the 2002 Essen Motor Show, the Tarek was inspired by Volkswagen's W12 supercar concepts and the Touareg off-roader. It was equipped with a 1.9L 218hp TDI diesel engine generating around 288 ft-lb of torque. Tipping the scales at just over 2,600 lbs. this was plenty of power for outrunning the more powerful gasoline-engined competitors. The rear-wheel drive buggy was based on a light-weight tubular frame covered by carbon-fiber bodywork designed by ItalDesign - Giugiaro S.p.A.

Kleinschmidt ultimately finished in 8th place with no stage wins.
